''", u'And , as the Great Day of Judgment draws near , it remains for us to consider the greatness of the punishment which is to follow that condemnation or damnation which we have consigned the whole world unto , in the Name of God .', u'All their sinfulness deserves a great punishment a punishment so great that it can not be fully comprehended by our thoughts , nor ever be sufficiently expressed , in time or in eternity .', u"The old Puritan , Thomas Goodwin ( 1600 - 1679 ) in his great work , An Unregenerate Man 's Guiltiness Before God has a chapter entitled , `` Of the punishment of sin in hell .", u'In which chapter he writes : `` For what hell and destruction are , is a mystery , as well as what heaven is ; and the true and proper notion or conception of either , are a riddle to the most of men .', u'As `eye hath not seen , ear not heard , nor hath it entered into the heart of man ( i.e.', u", the natural man ) , what God hath prepared for those that love him ; ' so , nor what God hath prepared for them that hate him .", u"For it is the same , and no other punishment but that which is `prepared for the devil and his angels , ' as Christ says ( `` Depart from me , ye cursed , into everlasting fire , PREPARED FOR THE DEVIL AND HIS ANGELS .
